title: Gift/Grant Agreements with the Koret Foundation as related to UC Davis

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Gift/Grant Agreements with the Koret Foundation as related to UC Davis
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- a copy of all gift agreements and grant agreements made between the UC Regents or UC Office of the President and the Koret Foundation, which fund research or academic programs on one of UC Davis's campus, made between the dates January 1, 2020 and the date of this request's fulfillment.
- a copy of all gift agreements and grant agreements made between UC Davis and the Koret Foundation, made between the dates January 1, 2020 and the date of this request's fulfillment.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ed Burton

title: Army book search re: DEI Executive Order

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Army book search re: DEI Executive Order
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. The memo sent or signed by Derrick Anderson concerning books in libraries (including West Point), as described in an April 16, 2025, article published by the Associated Press and available here: https://apnews.com/article/dei-army-air-force-libraries-book-purge-c191f572cf62aa99a4dae9c259925626.

2. A copy of the interim list of books sent to the Army's chief librarian (which list is due by April 16, 2025).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

title: Air Force Academy book search re: DEI Executive Order (United States Air Force Academy)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. The memo sent or signed by Gwendolyn DeFilippi concerning books in the library (or libraries) of the Air Force Academy, as described in an April 16, 2025, article published by the Associated Press and available here: https://apnews.com/article/dei-army-air-force-libraries-book-purge-c191f572cf62aa99a4dae9c259925626.

2. A copy of the interim list of books (which is due by April 30, 2025).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh
